content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Max Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was about the rental price of the apartment I was offering for rent.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why didn't you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The final price was not agreed upon because the potential tenant was unable to meet my asking price for the apartment. I rejected his offers that were lower than my asking price, and he ultimately decided to continue his search elsewhere.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner at 7. There were disagreements due to the price negotiations, but overall, the interaction was respectful and cordial.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation process. The interactions were respectful and focused on the topic of discussion, which was the rental price of the apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt
